actions.recommendation: Weight loss will mitigate risk significantly.
Cholesterol needs to be addressed with diet and lifestyle and monitored.
You need to reduce the sugar and refined carbs in your diet, increase your physical activity and loose weight to try and stop the potential for developing diabetes.
Visit your GP to do a fasting insulin test and a post prandial insulin and glucose test to see if there is any resistance developing, especially if you struggle to lose weight after trying.

Weight loss will reduce your risk for chronic diseases of lifestyle and will keep you healthier for longer. According to the DNA diet test you should follow a low card diet and exercise 24 MET hours a week too lose weight.

Increase intake of cruciferous and allium veggies and consider supplementation with DIM and Sulfonurane (solal: IC3 DIM and Medford: cellasure). Continue to avoid alcohol. Choose organic foods and avoid toxins and synthetic additives where possible.

Inflammation increases risk of cancer, diabetes, heart disease, cognitive decline and joint pain. Omega 3 supplementation is advised. Moderate intensity exercise and weight loss will improve inflammation significantly. Use ginger and turmeric (heated) or curcumin where possible, all eat lots of veggies especially and fruit with red and purple colours.
Buy a rebounder to do 10-20 min at home daily, looking for a Pilates and bounce class in your area or getting a personal trainer to come to your house.
